item.title: Latest news - AFET committee meetings - Committee on Foreign Affairs
item.description:
Next AFET committee meetings will be held on:

  • Wednesday 5 February, Brussels - "in camera"
  • Wednesday 19 and Thursday 20 February 2025, Brussels, room Antall 4Q2
Meetings are webstreamed with the exception of agenda items held "in camera".

item.title: Press release - MEPs: support for Venezuela’s opposition is a “moral duty”
item.description:
The regime of Nicolas Maduro is illegitimate and his presidency constitutes an unlawful attempt to remain in power by force, MEPs say in a resolution adopted on Thursday.
Committee on Foreign Affairs

Source : © European Union, 2025 - EP

item.title: Press release - Parliament denounces the upcoming sham presidential election in Belarus
item.description:
In a resolution adopted on Wednesday, MEPs call on the EU to reject the upcoming presidential election in Belarus on 26 January as a sham.
Committee on Foreign Affairs

Source : © European Union, 2025 - EP

item.title: Press release - Rutte to MEPs: “We are safe now, we might not be safe in five years”
item.description:
On Monday afternoon, MEPs discussed the security situation in Europe and beyond as well as defence and EU-NATO cooperation with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte.
Committee on Foreign Affairs
Subcommittee on Security and Defence

item.title: Press release - MEPs to discuss European and global security with NATO Secretary General Rutte
item.description:
On Monday, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte will make his first official visit to the European Parliament since taking office on 1 October 2024.
Committee on Foreign Affairs
